item.title: german al qaeda member jailed for nearly five years
item.description: a german man was sentenced to four years and nine months in prison on monday for being a member of the international islamist militant group al qaeda.

item.title: soaring djokovic now ready to challenge nadal on clay
item.description: novak djokovic has been invincible so far this year but his assault on rafa nadal's world number one ranking could be about to hit the skids.

item.title: new york man charged with importing banned fish from china
item.description: a new york man who admitted smuggling nearly 4,000 live chinese snakehead fish, which pose a danger to fish native to u.s. waters, was arrested on criminal charges, prosecutors said on thursday.

item.title: california man admits threatening congressman
item.description: a california man pleaded guilty on wednesday to threatening to kill congressman jim mcdermott in phone messages that railed against the washington state democrat's opposition to extending federal tax cuts.

item.title: study backs new drug for typhoid in poor countries
item.description: a large trial comparing treatments for typhoid has backed the use of gatifloxacin, an antibiotic launched by bristol myers squibb in the united states but withdrawn amid worries about side effects.

item.description: merit scholarships help law schools enhance their cachet, but grading curves often make it impossible for students to keep the grants.

item.description: stress tests on ireland's four main lenders will reveal a capital hole of around 20 billion euros ($28.2 billion), the sunday business post reported, without citing any sources.
